content: Was the Eiffel Tower built for the 1889 World Exposition?

Yes, the Eiffel Tower was built specifically for the 1889 World's Fair, also known as the Exposition Universelle, which was held in Paris to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution. The tower was designed by Gustave Eiffel and his team, and it served as the entrance arch to the exposition. It was initially criticized by some artists and intellectuals who thought it was an eyesore, but it has since become a beloved symbol of Paris and France.
